title: Maximum Element in Array
scenario: You are working on a data analysis tool that needs to quickly find the largest value in datasets.
description:
Given an array of integers, find and print the maximum element present in the array. The array will contain at least one element.

Example:
Input: [3, 5, 7, 2, 8]
Output: 8

Input: [-5, -2, -10, -1]
Output: -1
input_format:
First line contains an integer t, the number of test cases.
For each test case:
- First line contains an integer n, the size of the array
- Second line contains n space-separated integers representing the array elements
output_format:
For each test case, print a single integer representing the maximum element in the array.
After each test case output, print a single '~' character on a new line.
hint: You can iterate through the array once and keep track of the maximum value seen so far.

driver_codes.complete_driver_code:
def find_max(arr):

#USER_CODE#

t = int(input())
for _ in range(t):
    n = int(input())
    arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
    result = find_max(arr)
    print(result)
    print('~')
